description: My last attempt on the Horsehead Nebula was one year ago - with my astro-modified Nikon D500 on the SkyWatcher Star Adventurer. Still remember that night at Fort Griffin Historical Site, with so much trouble trying to aim the Nikkor 70-200mm lens, could only track for 60 seconds, cranking up all the way up to ISO 5000. Finally only saw the faint horsehead showing up on the view finder - Pure Joy at that moment. Here comes the revisit. The H-Alpha data was collected at home and RGB data was from TAS Atoka site this Monday. It was freezing cold (-4C). Somehow I still feel something is missing. I haven't figure it out yet. The resolving power of the GT-81 is not enough to bring up the most important details. I tried to order an Astrodon Sloan i' filter for this target for the infrared data. The order never delivered. It will happen later, I hope. Pre-processing of Ha Master - Calibration / Integration, Astro Pixel Processor - Dynamic Background Extraction, PixInsight - Deconvolution, PixInsight - MultiscaleLinearTransformation (Denoise), PixInsight - ScreenTransferFunction / HistogramTransformation, PixInsight. Pre-processing of RGB Masters - Calibration / Integration, Astro Pixel Processor - Dynamic Background Extraction, PixInsight - MultiscaleLinearTransformation (Denoise), PixInsight - MorphologicalTransformation, PixInsight - ScreenTransferFunction / HistogramTransformation, PixInsight. HaRGB Combination & Post-processing - LRGBCombination (Ha master as the Lum), PixInsight - Final Touch-up, Photoshop
title: HaRGB - B33 - Horsehead Nebula
